column1: 8/10 - You have identified a business function that could benefit from scrum/sprint methodologies, but the explanation could be more focused on the specific benefits of the approach. Keep up the good work!

Rating: 10 pts

Comment: Good job explaining the use of scrum/sprint and kanban for Mighty Jaxx's business functions. Keep up the good work!

7 pts - Some vagueness or incompleteness in discussion of fit

Comment: Good effort in discussing the use of Kanban, but the explanation of why it is a poor fit for the function could be clearer and more specific.

10 pts - Great job identifying the business function of producing 2D renderings as a suitable candidate for implementing kanban methodologies. Your explanation of the process and the example Kanban board provided a clear understanding of how it could operate in this context. Keep up the good work!
12 pts - Very complete and clear description of how kanban could operate. Great job on providing a detailed example of the Kanban board for Mighty Jaxx. Keep up the good work!

7 pts - Some vagueness or incompleteness in discussion of fit.

Comment: Good effort in discussing the methodologies, but the explanation of why scrum/sprint is a poor fit for the function could be clearer and more specific. Keep up the good work!

5 pts - Selected bias is clearly relevant to this situation.

Great job identifying confirmation bias and sunk cost fallacy as relevant biases for Jackson's decision-making process. Keep up the good work!

8 pts - Right idea for definition, but some vagueness or illogic

Good effort in identifying confirmation bias and sunk cost fallacy as potential traps for Jackson's thinking. However, the definition of these biases could be clearer and more concise. Keep up the good work!

Rating: 10 pts

Comment: Good job on describing the possible problems and solutions, but some details could be clearer. Keep up the good work!
8/10 - Your description of the Kanban board for Mighty Jaxx is reasonable, but it could use more detail on the specific steps and actions involved in the process. Keep up the good work!
